title: This Week in Twitter : EA Emeka ( Egbuka ), Touchdown Trey Thursdays and Garrett Wilson Explains Why Ohio State is WRU
body_text:
This Week in Twitter is a look at some of the week’s best and most entertaining tweets from Buckeyeland and beyond.
Braxton Miller has been selected for the Ohio State Athletics Hall of Fame Class of 2024. It's a well-deserved honor for the former Buckeye quarterback and wide receiver.
Blessed to be selected for the Ohio State Athletics Hall of Fame Class of 2024.. Buckeye Nation, I'll love ya'll forever.. #GoBucks @OhioStateFB pic.twitter.com/eDPGyR4DyR
— BRAXTON MILLER (@BraxtonMiller5) May 31, 2024
This gives us another reason to show the greatest spin move of all time. Crazy to think that it's been nearly nine years since Miller did this at Virginia Tech.
September 7, 2015: Braxton Miller spin cycle. pic.twitter.com/xHIwUPY7nP
— This Day In Sports Clips (@TDISportsClips) September 7, 2023
EA Sports College Football 25 gave us nearly five minutes of video showing us the gameplay for the most talked about game release in quite some time.
One step closer to making game day every day#CFB25 Coming July 19
— EASPORTSCollege (@EASPORTSCollege) May 31, 2024
Pre-Order Now : https://t.co/h079QzWxaP pic.twitter.com/t2t5r6olzA
For Ohio State fans: EA Emeka is now a thing....and it's beautiful.
EA Emeka pic.twitter.com/h734jdqGCf
— Ohio State Football (@OhioStateFB) May 31, 2024
What are some of your favorite food spots in Columbus, Buckeye Nation?
Best food spots in CBUS pic.twitter.com/aJAFGCbNoV
— Ohio State Football (@OhioStateFB) May 28, 2024
A healthy TreVeyon Henderson is elite – and Touchdown Trey Thursdays should be a thing up until the season opener against Akron.
Touchdown Trey Thursday @TreVeyonH4 pic.twitter.com/4aIDUoJg5A
— Ohio State Football (@OhioStateFB) May 30, 2024
Garrett Wilson explains why Ohio State is, in fact, WRU. Perfect practice makes perfect, always remember that.
Garrett Wilson talks about the success of Ohio State wide receivers:
— Jets Videos (@snyjets) May 29, 2024
"We know how to practice. We practice as hard as possible so the game is what it is... we're always competitive as hell." pic.twitter.com/ieC2iuqzGl
Oh, speaking of WRU and perfecting practice habits to become elite on the field.
Year 2 loading... pic.twitter.com/03BCAVaoEk
— Seattle Seahawks (@Seahawks) May 31, 2024
Marvin Harrison Jr. is clearly (and has been) ready for the NFL. The question is: Is the NFL, specifically cornerbacks across the league, ready for Route Man Marv?
Swift with it@K1 | @MarvHarrisonJr pic.twitter.com/pjbB9cYMms
— Arizona Cardinals (@AZCardinals) May 30, 2024
Is there anything C.J. Stroud isn't good at? Seriously. (Besides the S2 Cognition Test)
Shoutout to @CJ7STROUD for earning the PFWA Good Guy Award for his professionalism in helping football writers do their jobs! pic.twitter.com/LokRKG68g6
— Houston Texans (@HoustonTexans) May 29, 2024
Mike Hall Jr. getting drafted by his hometown team is pretty freaking sweet. The Cleveland Browns give us a behind-the-scenes look at the rookie's first few weeks with his favorite NFL team.
From the halls of Streetsboro HS to the Shoe in Columbus and back to Cleveland, @MichaelHallJr_ embodies Ohio.
— Cleveland Browns (@Browns) May 29, 2024
Go behind the scenes of his first few weeks in orange and brown in a new , presented by @UHhospitals, out now on YouTube!
: https://t.co/TIUHVyog0W pic.twitter.com/bKIDvV9OFe
Well done, Sonny and Lorenzo Styles Jr. Well done.
"We grew up privileged, we're able to play at Ohio State, so for us to give back to kids our age that touches home for us"
— Adam King (@AdamKing10TV) June 1, 2024
Its midnight and the Styles brothers are at Chase Plaza getting ready to Sleep Out.
The family raised $13,000 for youth homelessness and Huckleberry House pic.twitter.com/GIhRC3JObU
Some former Ohio State women's hockey players won the PWHL's Walter Cup Championship.
.@thepwhlofficial Walter Cup Champions
— Ohio State Women's Hockey (@OhioStateWHKY) May 30, 2024
Congrats Clair, @_sophiejaques + @LizSchepers on the 'ship! #GoBucks | #ProBucks pic.twitter.com/4kyLx1bmVJ
Just a friendly reminder that two of the top three cornerbacks in the 2025 recruiting class – No. 1 Devin Sanchez and No. 3 Na'eem Offord – are currently committed to Ohio State. The duo took plenty of pictures together at On3 Elite this past week, with this one featuring Sanchez and Offord not only holding a Buckeye helmet, but wearnbgn OSU shirts as well.
There are 3 CBs in the 2025 Class that are 5-Star Recruits on every website
— Hayes Fawcett (@Hayesfawcett3) May 29, 2024
2 of those 3 are Committed to Ohio State
Devin Sanchez (No. 1 CB)
Naeem Offord (No. 3 CB)#BIA x #On3Elite https://t.co/VEhKwFrdD1 pic.twitter.com/ovwMh4rbGX
After continuing to improve in his first season in Columbus in 2024, Josh Simmons has a chance to be a dominant left tackle for the Buckeyes this fall.
Ohio State LT Josh Simmons Last Season:
— PFF College (@PFF_College) May 30, 2024
443 Pass Block Snaps
One Sack Allowed pic.twitter.com/Qf9keQ0iss
Former Ohio State running back Master Teague III is selling plenty of Buckeye gear.
Btw, I still have some Buckeye items in my closet if you want any of them https://t.co/SCPYlujGjY
— Master W. Teague III (@MasterTeagueIII) May 30, 2024
Never forget Jaxon Smith-Njigba's historic Rose Bowl performance in 2022, when he totaled 15 catches for 347 yards and three touchdowns. Absolute dominance.
The single greatest rose bowl performance was Ohio State JSN. pic.twitter.com/05CIqWi1qq
— College Football Alerts (@CFBAlerts_) May 28, 2024
If Jeff Okudah can stay healthy, he will have one heckuva season this year with his new team. You heard it here first.
Got it on lockdown pic.twitter.com/klWtPfgAr1
— Houston Texans (@HoustonTexans) May 31, 2024
